item.title: [Pi] Being picky [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:3, topic:540857”][quote author=cammyPVPftw link=topic=659725.msg4411592#msg4411592 date=1393946999]
Put it under your process method.
[/quote]lol

[hr]
In your button click packet, once the exp lock is toggled just send the new frame.

case ####: expLock = !expLock; getPA().sendFrame126(" @yel@" + expLock ? "On" : "Off", 7337); break;[/quote]

Thanks man!

Read full topic

[hr]
In your button click packet, once the exp lock is toggled just send the new frame.

case ####: expLock = !expLock; getPA().sendFrame126(" @yel@" + expLock ? "On" : "Off", 7337); break;[/quote]
Wow, I’m an idiot. I forgot you can send the correct frame.

item.title: [Pi] Being picky [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

Hey guys, so I’m being kind of picky here, but this just annoys me more than anything. In my quest tab, you have an Experience Lock button that when you can unlock/lock your exp with. So, whenever you click it, it doesn’t update until the player moves. So if my EXP lock is on, and I click it, it won’t turn to off until I move. I know this is a stupid thing, it just irritates me, how can I make it instantly update?

if (expLock == true) { getPA().sendFrame126(" @yel@On", 7337); // quest title } else if (expLock == false) { getPA().sendFrame126(" @yel@Off", 7337); // quest title }

Read full topic
